front.title: The Strategist
front.setup: Put all Condition cards aside as the Condition deck. Search the villain deck for all Trap cards; shuffle them and deal H face-down. Put the other trap cards aside. Put The Simurgh into play "The Strategist" side up.

gameplay.p: Reduce damage dealt to the Simurgh by 1

At the start of the villain turn reveal the top card of the Condition deck. Then reveal the top X cards of the villain deck, where X is the number of revealed trap cards + 1. Return them to the villain deck in ascending order by their ⚠
At the end of the villain turn if all trap cards are revealed flip this card

front.advanced: At the start of the villain turn, reveal the top card of the Condition deck

back.title: Wings Unfurled

gameplay.p: Reduce damage dealt to the Simurgh by 1
At the start of the villain turn, reveal the top H + 1 cards of the villain deck. Put them back on the villain deck in ascending order by their ⚠
At the end of the villain turn, place a token on the Simurgh. Then all heroes deal themselves X psychic damage, where X is the number of tokens on the Simurgh

back.advanced: Players may not discuss strategy or tactics

card.name: A Surfeit of Options
card.text: When this card is revealed if there are at least H Ongoing cards in play, flip over a face-down trap card and remove this card from the game. Otherwise return this card to the Condition deck and shuffle it

quote.text: She requires resources. This requires patience.

card.name: An Attack Expected
card.text: When this card is revealed if the Simurgh took damage last round, flip over a face-down trap card and remove this card from the game. Otherwise return this card to the Condition deck and shuffle it

quote.text: She must be unmolested. This is given freely to her.

card.name: A Backup Sabotaged
card.text: When this card is revealed if any hero has multiple copies of the same card in their hand, flip over a face-down trap card and remove this card from the game. Otherwise return this card to the Condition deck and shuffle it

quote.text: The heroes had cut the power, and the Simurgh was still managing to activate the thing.

card.name: A Wealth of Targets
card.text: When this card is revealed if there are at least H non-character-card targets in play, flip over a face-down trap card and remove this card from the game. Otherwise return this card to the Condition deck and shuffle it

quote.text: With study and careful precision, each ball can find its pocket. Spheres of synthetic resin meet the furthest point of a ledge covered by woven wool, perching on the edge as they spend their momentum.

card.name: An Unfortunate Malfunction
card.text: When this card is revealed if there are at least H Equipment cards in play, flip over a face-down trap card and remove this card from the game. Otherwise return this card to the Condition deck and shuffle it

quote.text: She requires access to particular information. This can be arranged by positioning targets carefully.

text.p: When this card is flipped, every player must secretly and without discussion vote for a hero by simultaneously pointing at a hero card (Count down from 3). If there is a clear winner, that hero deals itself 5 psychic damage. Otherwise, every hero deals themselves 5 psychic damage.
This card is indestructible

quote.text: An obstacle must be removed. This is critical, but she is blind to it. This is the greatest problem she faces.

text.p: Damage that would be dealt to hero targets cannot be redirected
This card is indestructible

quote.text: One cape began to launch ice crystals towards the hoop, and the Simurgh caught the shards out of the air with her telekinesis. The crystals flew into the man with the forcefield bubble, shattering. The resulting shards and flakes of crystal didn't fly away, however. They turned around in the air and condensed in a thick shell around the force field.

text.p: Whenever a hero target would deal more than X damage, where X = 8 - H, that hero target deals itself 1 psychic damage
This card is indestructible

quote.text: "It's going to backfire. I've said it before, I'll say it now, and I'll remind you all I said it with every chance I get, from now until the day I die. It's going to backfire."

text.p: At the start of the villain turn, the heroes name a card type. Reveal the top two cards of every hero deck. Return cards of the named type to the top of the deck, discard the others
Whenever a hero card goes to the trash, that hero deals themselves 1 psychic damage
This card is indestructible

quote.text: "If she's answering questions for us, we don't want to know"

text.p: When this card is flipped, destroy every non-character-card target in play. The Simurgh deals X psychic damage to all hero targets, where X = the number of targets destroyed in this way
This card is indestructible

quote.text: A tide of snow and ice hit him like a truck, driving him into the ragged edge of the building. Oliver yelped as he threw himself out of the way. Marissa's shriek seemed oddly delayed, until Krouse noted what had happened to the man. The cape, in a bodysuit of velvet blue with gold armor, had been impaled on a tangled mess of rebar, his intestines pushed out the front of his stomach.

text.p: When this card is flipped, place 8 - H tokens on it. If there are ever no tokens on this card, the heroes lose the game
At the end of the villain turn, remove a token
Heroes may skip any two phases (play, power, draw) in order to place a token on this card
This card is indestructible
The bubble-man formed another shield around himself, but he left his companion out of it, choosing to interject himself between the Simurgh and the woman.
A section of concrete from a building to the right of the heroes flew free and caved in the costumed woman's skull.

When this card is flipped, every player must secretly and without discussion vote for a hero by simultaneously pointing at a hero card (Count down from 3). If there is a clear winner, destroy every card owned by that hero except the character card. Otherwise, destroy all hero cards except character cards.
This card is indestructible

quote.text: The circle flared with more light than before, and the resulting shockwave threw Krouse and his friends into the air. Windows shattered and snow was kicked up into clouds as tall as the high rises around them. The sky visibly darkened with the clouds that had been kicked up, heaping snowbanks dissolved into their constituent snowflakes and water molecules. The indistinct and distant noises of the heroes firing on the Simurgh had stopped all at once, as the heroes were killed or left reeling from the aftershock of the device's activation.

text.p: If all trap cards are revealed, play the top card of the villain deck
Otherwise, Flip over a face down trap card, then shuffle this card back into the villain deck

quote.text: He glanced over his shoulder, saw the various components of the circle crackling with current as it rose behind the Simurgh, like a gargantuan halo, wide enough that it nearly exceeded her wingspan.

text.p: The environment deals X instances of 1 projectile damage spread out over all hero targets, where X = 2 * H - 1
The environment deals X instances of 1 irreducible projectile damage spread out over all hero targets, where X = (H-1) * (H-1)

quote.text: There was a sudden movement from the Simurgh, tearing sections of wall free from the nearest building, maneuvering them to form a makeshift barrier in mid-air. Not one second after the barrier was in place, a pair of heroes flew around the corner.

text.p: Destroy all equipment cards in play. Reveal the top X cards of the villain deck, where X = the number of cards destroyed in this way. Put them back on the villain deck in ascending order by their ⚠

quote.text: The Simurgh stopped and raised one hand. Pieces of machinery began to flow out of a gaping hole in the side of the building nearest where she'd landed, stopping when they reached her immediate vicinity. A massive box that looked like an oversized washing machine, a large engine with blue L.E.D.s lining it, and tendrils of electrical cords with frayed ends still sparking with live current.

text.p: When this card is revealed, play it
Destroy all hero ongoing cards

quote.text: Pretercognition. Spread out over several targets at once, it serves as her primary sense. Each target is conceptualized in the context of twelve to eighty years of history.

text.p: The first time each round the Simurgh would be dealt damage, redirect that damage to the hero with the lowest HP

quote.text: Another power extends in the other direction, and this is not one that can be sensed by most. Possibilities, as another jumble of images. These clarify as the others do, as eventualities are discarded, the targets around her coming into focus.

text.p: When this card is revealed, play it
The Simurgh deals X psychic damage to all hero targets, where X = the number of revealed trap cards + 1

quote.text: The Simurgh lifted Lucas' apartment building into the air and tore it into shreds. The various fragments, the little things, the bodies and pieces of furniture, they became part of a protective maelstrom around the Simurgh, orbiting her and blocking the barrage of long-range fire that the good guys were directing at her.

text.p: The Simurgh deals H psychic damage to the hero with the least cards in play

quote.text: The result is hallucinations, momentary or sustained. Hearing sounds, seeing things, smelling something, where none truly exist. Fight or flight response feeds need for escapism. A hallucination serves as the first step into a daydream.

text.p: Play the top H cards of the environment deck

quote.text: Frame a situation to put a target under optimal fear and stress. Hormone secretions increase. Manipulate situation to a position where they will connect familiar visual, olfactory and auditory cues to their immediate environment.

text.p: Reveal the top H cards of the villain trash. Play the one with the lowest ⚠

quote.text: Telekinesis. She'd created a false image of herself out of snow and ice, baiting Scion away. Judging by the sound of Scion's continued onslaught, she was still controlling it. Controlling it even though there was no way she could see what it was doing by eyesight alone.
